009
010package imagingbook.pub.color.image;
011
012import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
013
014/*
015 * This class implements a D65-based sRGBcolor space without performing
016 * chromatic adaptation between D50 and D65, as required by Java's profile 
017 * connection space. Everything is D65!
018 */
019
020public class sRgb65ColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
021
022        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
023
024        public sRgb65ColorSpace() {
025                super(ColorSpace.TYPE_RGB, 3);
026        }
027
028        // XYZ (D65) -> sRGB
029        @Override
030        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] xyz) {
031                final double X = xyz[0];
032                final double Y = xyz[1];
033                final double Z = xyz[2];
034                
035                // XYZ -> RGB (linear components)
036                final double r =  3.240479 * X + -1.537150 * Y + -0.498535 * Z;
037                final double g = -0.969256 * X +  1.875992 * Y +  0.041556 * Z;
038                final double b =  0.055648 * X + -0.204043 * Y +  1.057311 * Z;
039                
040                // RGB -> sRGB (nonlinear components)
041                float rr = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(r);
042                float gg = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(g);
043                float bb = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(b);                        
044                return new float[] {rr,gg,bb} ;
045        }
046
047        @Override
048        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
049                return srgb;
050        }
051
052        // sRGB -> XYZ (D65)
053        @Override
054        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] srgb) {
055                // get linear rgb components:
056                final double r = sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[0]);
057                final double g = sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[1]);
058                final double b = sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[2]);
059                
060                // convert to XYZ (Poynton / ITU 709) 
061                final float x = (float) (0.412453 * r + 0.357580 * g + 0.180423 * b);
062                final float y = (float) (0.212671 * r + 0.715160 * g + 0.072169 * b);
063                final float z = (float) (0.019334 * r + 0.119193 * g + 0.950227 * b);
064                return new float[] {x, y, z};
065        }
066
067        @Override
068        public float[] toRGB(float[] srgb) {
069                return srgb;
070        }
071
072
073}
